Pre-Game Insights: The Mets sit with a 2-1 record in this series and now they have complete control. One more win and they'll take on the Padres or Dodgers in the NLCS.
Pete Alonso hit a home run to start off the scoring in the 2nd inning and they never looked back on the way to the win.
Sean Manaea got the start and he went seven innings giving up three hits and one run.
Jose Quintana, who has a 10-10 record and an ERA of 3.75, will start for the Mets. In his last start against the Milwaukee Brewers, he went six innings giving up four hits and zero runs.

Ranger Suarez, who finished the regular season with a 12-8 record and an ERA of 3.46, will start for the Phillies. His last start came on September 27th against the Washington Nationals and he went two innings giving up seven hits and six runs.
